titleStmt.title: J. R. Usher to James F. Robinson
CWG7647

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1862-1863

body.p:
Department of the Interior
Washington April 9th 1863
Sir

Your communication of March 6th, addressed to the President, enclosing a certified copy of the Act of the General Assembly of Kentucky, accepting the provisions of the Act of Congress, entitled "An Act donating Public Lands to the Several States and Territories which may provide Colleges for the benefit of Agriculture and the Mechanic Arts," has been, by him, refered to this Department, and the papers have been placed on file in the General Land Office

I am, Sir, Very Respectfully
Your Obt Servant
J R Usher
Secretary

His Excellency
J. F. Robinson
Governor of Kentucky
Frankfort
K.Y
Letter from Secretary of Dept. of Interior Acknowledging receipt copy of all of Kenty Legislature accepting Provisions for Agr. Colleges
